page.title: 15LOCAL LANGUAGE LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: "Oh Eppie, I'm richt gled I've got a haud o' ye. I've been cryin' ye a' the wye up fae Lossie Cross", gasped Ella. "Ach, I'm awfy sorry, I didna hear ye cryin' me", apologised Eppie. "Fit hiv ye brocht this week onywye?" "I took some daffies oot the gaerden." "Jist look at Muggie's man's grave. Fit a state it's in!", said Eppie in disgust. "An' she blabs tae a'bidy that she goes up every Sunday tae pit doon flo'ers." "I ken, her hoose is like a midden an' a'!" agreed Ella. "Michty me! Is that the time? I should be awa' tae the kirk." "Ach, dinna fash yersel'. We'll pit in oor apologies efter." {Glossary:- dinna fash yersel'-don't worry, pit-put, a'bidy-everybody, ken-know, fit-what, midden-pigsty,michty me-gosh
